text: Reinforcement type and size as per approved structural drawings
Rebar is free from rust, oil, dirt, and deformation
Rebar mill certificates and delivery records available on-site

id: B. Rebar Cutting, Bending, and Placement

text: Cutting and bending conforms to approved bar bending schedules
Rebar placed per layout and location indicated in structural drawings
Bars are correctly lapped, spliced, and offset per code requirements
Bar spacing and clearances maintained per drawings and CSA/ACI standards
Reinforcement properly tied using tie wire; ties are secure and trimmed
Mechanical couplers (if used) installed and torqued per manufacturer’s instructions
Bar supports (chairs, bolsters, spacers) used to maintain concrete cover
Minimum concrete cover provided per drawings and code (slabs, beams, walls, columns)
Rebar adequately secured to prevent displacement during pour
Rebar does not obstruct sleeves, openings, or embedded items
Dowels and anchors placed as per layout and fixed prior to pour
Coordination with electrical and mechanical embeds completed before closing
Site safe and free from protruding bars or trip hazards
Reinforcement inspected and approved by QA/QC / structural / client (if required)
Photos taken for documentation and record
Inspection sign-off completed prior to placement
